New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder won their franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season game.
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 29 points and had a game-high eight assists.
The Thunder scored 42 third-quarter points to take an 18-point lead into the fourth quarter.
Jalen Williams scored 18 points and Isaiah Hartenstein added 11 points and nine rebounds for Oklahoma City.
Amir Coffey led the Clippers with 26 points.
The Thunder added to their league-leading steal total with 11 takeaways.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder trailed by 16 in the first half before pulling within 52-48 at halftime.
Despite the slow start, the Thunder's depth eventually overwhelmed the Clippers, who were without James Harden, a late scratch.
Williams hit a runner at the halftime buzzer to cut the Clippers lead to four, then scored the first six points of the second half to jumpstart a 23-5 run that put the Thunder in control.

Norman Powell came into the game averaging a career high 24.3 points per game. He missed his first nine shots and didn’t get a basket until eight minutes remained, finishing with six points on 1-of-11 shooting including 0-for-5 from three-point range.
